sentence.Network_en: "That's a nice dress," said Michael. "Thanks," she replied solemnly.
sentence.Network_cn: “那件衣服很好看，”迈克尔说。“谢谢，”她严肃地回答。

sentence.Network_en: I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 我郑重发誓，总有一天我将回到欧洲生活。

sentence.Network_en: A military parade marched slowly and solemnly down Pennsylvania Avenue.
sentence.Network_cn: 阅兵队列沿宾夕法尼亚大道缓慢而庄严地行进。

entry.def: Someone or something that is solemn is very serious rather than cheerful or humorous.

example.ex: His solemn little face broke into smiles...
example.tran: 他严肃的小脸蛋上突然绽放出笑容。

entry.def: A solemn promise or agreement is one that you make in a very formal, sincere way.

example.ex: ...a solemn pledge that he would never remarry.
example.tran: 他永远不再结婚的郑重承诺

means.word_mean: 1. in a grave and sedate manner;

auth_sentence.content: The enquiries into the deaths were extensive and solemnly undertaken.
auth_sentence.res_content: The enquiries into the deaths were extensive and solemnly undertaken.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The enquiries into the deaths were extensive and solemnly undertaken.

auth_sentence.content: This, he says, solemnly, is where Nixon works.
auth_sentence.res_content: This, he says, solemnly, is where Nixon works.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This, he says, solemnly, is where Nixon works.

auth_sentence.content: I'm afraid of divorce,'  the mother-in-law-to-be said, solemnly.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm afraid of divorce,' the mother-in-law-to-be said, solemnly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm afraid of divorce,'  the mother-in-law-to-be said, solemnly.

sentences.en: The two sides solemnly declared,“The region must be made immune from any foreign interference.
sentences.cn: ”双方庄严宣告：“必须使这一地区免受外国干涉。”

sentences.en: The whole city solemnly assembled on the square.
sentences.cn: 全市人民在广场上隆重集会。

sentences.en: He vowed quite solemnly that he would carry out his promise.
sentences.cn: 他非常庄严地发誓要实现他的诺言。

sentences.en: He solemnly declared that it was true.
